isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine - Model Years Late 1997 to 2003 - Cylinder Head And Valves - Cylinder Head Disassembly - Remove Fuel Injector

note.para: Make sure the fuel rails and oil rails have been drained before removing the fuel injectors.

figure.caption: Removing the Mounting Bolt for the Fuel Injector Hold Down Clamp

step1.para: Remove all mounting bolts from the outboard (exhaust manifold side) fuel injector hold down clamps.

figure.caption: Disengaging the Fuel Injector Hold Down Clamp

caution.para: To prevent damage to the shoulder bolt, make sure the fuel injector hold down clamp is free of the shoulder bolt when prying up on the clamp.

note.para: The shoulder bolts on the inboard side are not accessible and do not require removal.

step1.para: Disengage the fuel injector hold down clamp from the inboard shoulder bolt by sliding the clamp up and away from the valve springs, then up and over the head of shoulder bolt.

Use a fuel injector removal tool to remove the fuel injector from the cylinder head bore. Install the "T" screw into the hold down clamp. Insert the fulcrum under the outboard side of the hold down clamp. Turn the screw until the fuel injector is unseated.

figure.caption: Installing the "T" Screw Into the Hold Down Clamp
Removing the Fuel Injector From the Cylinder Head

step1.para: Remove the fuel injector from the cylinder head bore by lifting the fuel injector straight up and out. Place the fuel injector in a fuel injector holder rack.
Remove the shoulder bolt (one per injector).

caution.para: To avoid damage to the engine, always replace the O-rings and seals whenever a fuel injector is removed. Refer to the Fuel Injector O-Rings and Seals procedure in this section.
